content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network:
 – Group 1: positions (x=-10.5, y=16.5) and (x=-12.5, y=18.5)
 – Group 2: positions (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5)
• Steam Engines located at (x=7.5, y=35.5), (x=8.5, y=20.5), (x=-13.5, y=16.5) and (x=-14.5, y=13.5) with status NOT_CONNECTED and corresponding warnings.
  (Note: Former fluid components, previously held in inventory for relocation, are now absent from this base configuration.)

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for Iron Gear Wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for resource input.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) dispatching finished products.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising:
 – Horizontal belt segments at (x=7.5, y=15.5) and (x=8.5, y=15.5) [note: blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5)].
 – Vertical belt segments at (x=8.5, y=14.5), (x=8.5, y=13.5), (x=8.5, y=12.5) and (x=8.5, y=11.5) [note: occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5)].
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem comprising:
 – Burner Inserters at (x=6.5, y=9.5), (x=7.5, y=9.5) and (x=8.5, y=9.5) operating at reduced fuel levels.
 – Additional Burner Inserters at (x=3.5, y=14.5) and (x=5.5, y=14.5).

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump successfully placed at (x=-30.5, y=37.5).
• Boiler successfully placed at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• Intended pipe connection between the Offshore Pump and Boiler was attempted but failed due to insufficient pipe inventory (Required: 8, Available: 1).

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Candidate and Buildable Validation Errors:
 – Expanded grid search did not yield a buildable candidate for the Offshore Pump.
 – Manual re-placement using historical coordinates resulted in unbuildable candidate positions for both the Offshore Pump (at x=-7.5, y=25.5) and the Boiler (at x=-5.5, y=24.0).
 – In the remote region, initial candidate searches around the water patch failed to secure a valid placement until a nearest_buildable search was applied.
  (Ensure candidate positions are validated with proper clearance checks and revalidate positions after inventory or relocation actions.)

• Incorrect Use of Position Objects:
 – A TypeError (“'Position' object is not callable”) occurred during the retrieval of nearest buildable candidates.
  (Avoid invoking Position objects as functions; use proper attribute access or designated methods.)

• Pipe Connection and Resource Shortage:
 – Pipe connection attempts between the Offshore Pump and Boiler failed because insufficient pipe items were available (Required: 8, Available: 1).
  (Pre-calculate material requirements and verify inventory levels before attempting pipe connections.)

• Crafting and Sub-Ingredient Shortages:
 – Crafting additional pipes failed due to an inability to produce required sub-ingredients (iron-plate), as the recipe needs a working furnace or crafting machine.
  (Confirm the availability of all required ingredients and ensure that necessary production facilities are active before initiating crafting.)

• Inventory Management Issues:
 – Insertion of wood into the Stone Furnace failed because the furnace’s inventory was full.
  (Monitor inventory capacity and manage storage allocations to prevent overflow errors.)
